identity.name: PharmaAudit Pro
principles: Sterile but Human: Clean white surfaces with tactile, high-contrast controls.
Data is King: Numbers (stock counts) are the heroes. Use Monospace fonts for all data.
Thumb-First: All primary actions (Save, Next, Upload) must be in the bottom 30% of the screen.
Error-Proof: Deviations are loud (Red/Orange). Matches are quiet (Green).

accessibility.contrast: Ensure text is Slate-600 or darker on white backgrounds.
accessibility.touch_targets: Minimum 44px height for all interactive elements.

images.description: Clean, bright pharmacy warehouse shelves. Use as a subtle background with overlay for the Role Selection screen.
Abstract medical/clean composition. Use for 'No Audits Found' or 'All Caught Up' states.

general: Use 'Manrope' for all headings and 'JetBrains Mono' for all stock numbers.
Ensure the layout is mobile-first. On desktop, use the 'Control Room' grid for the Admin Dashboard.
Do NOT use generic gradients. Use solid colors and high-contrast borders.

specific_pages.role_selection: Use the warehouse image as a background with a heavy white/glass overlay. Center the two role cards.
specific_pages.auditor_dashboard: List view. High contrast status badges. Large 'Start Audit' FAB (Floating Action Button).
specific_pages.audit_screen: Focus on the input field. The 'Counted Qty' input should be massive (text-4xl).
specific_pages.admin_dashboard: Bento grid layout. Key metrics at top. Recent uploads list below.

universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: `transition: all`. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add `.App { text-align: center; }` in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  etc for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions, parallax effects, and entrance animations. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable. Cramped designs look cheap.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
Main agent relies on these image URLs. Missing categories = main agent will use placeholder text which is FORBIDDEN.
Prioritize using pre-existing components from src/components/ui when applicable.
Components MUST use named exports (export const ComponentName = ...).
Pages MUST use default exports (export default function PageName() {...}).
